summary: Artificial intelligence is an area of enormous potential for companies and investors . After a few difficult months, AI stocks could resume their 2024 momentum and soar in the second half . Three in particular could lead the way .  Nvidia's revenue surged 69% to $44 billion in the first quarter of the year . The chip giant is making investments in U.S. manufacturing to limit any eventual tariff impact . Nvidia trades for only 33 times forward earnings estimates, down from 50 times just a few months ago .  Trump threatened to impose a 25% tariff on Apple's imported iPhones . Apple has made efforts to diversify its manufacturing, with a plan to move much of it from China to India . All of this has hurt Apple stock, which is down about 20% since the start of the year .  Amazon's performance has been sluggish in recent times amid concerns that tariffs could hurt its e-commerce business and cloud computing unit, Amazon Web Services . The worst-case tariff scenario has been avoided, and the U.S. is making progress on trade agreements . Amazon has revamped its cost structure in recent years after facing pressure from inflation .  Amazon shares trade for 34 times forward earnings estimates, a reasonable level that could prompt investors to buy . AWS has been seeing tremendous growth from its AI efforts, which have helped it reach a $117 billion annual revenue run rate .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is994% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . Don’t miss out on the latest top 10 list, available when you joinStock Advisor .

Nvidia (NVDA) shares are keeping calm ahead of the AI darling’s shareholder meeting scheduled for June 25 . The chipmaker is unlikely to deliver fireworks at its upcoming annual event . There are three key things that investors will be watching on the coming Wednesday .  NVDA CEO Jensen Huang earned nearly $50 million in fiscal 2025 – up roughly 47% from the prior year, largely driven by stock rewards . Shareholders will vote to ratify PwC as Nvidia’s independent auditor on June 25 .  Wall Street remains bullish at large heading into NVDA’s annual shareholder meeting on June 25 . consensus rating on the company based out of Santa Clara, California remains at “Strong Buy” with the mean target of about $175 suggesting potential upside of more than 20% from here .

NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) is one of the best QQQ stocks to buy according to hedge funds . In FQ1 2026, NVIDIA reported strong financial results . Data Center revenue was particularly strong and reached $39.1 billion, which was up 73% year-over-year . NVIDIA forecasts revenue for FQ2 to be $45.0 billion, plus or minus 2% .  NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) is a computing infrastructure company that provides graphics and compute & networking solutions internationally . NVIDIA stands to benefit significantly from Trump-era tariffs and the onshoring trend, see our free report on the best short-term AI stock .

Bitcoin's long-held belief as a major volatile asset has been challenged amid the Iran-Israel conflict . On June 21, the United States carried out a strike on Iran, where it bombed three of its main nuclear facilities . Bitcoin's 60-day realized volatility had fallen to approximately 27% to 28%, according to Bitwise Europe's André Dragosch .  In February 2022, Bitcoin hit volatility levels of 60% to 65% during the onset of the Russia-Ukraine conflict, showing a stark difference from the current pattern . Analysts suggest that the difference is mainly attributed to long-term holders and institutional investors . Over 30% of Bitcoin's circulating supply is controlled by just 216 centralized entities .  U.S. aren’t safe in heated global tensions anymore, experts say . This story was originally reported by TheStreet on Jun 23, 2025, where it first appeared .

Nebius Group (NASDAQ:NBIS) is one of thebest technology stocks according to Wall Street analysts . Nebius announced the general availability of NVIDIA Corporation’s GB200 Grace Blackwell Superchip capacity for its customers in Europe . This marked a significant step in Nebius’ mission to build a comprehensive AI infrastructure globally .  Nebius Group (NASDAQ:NBIS) is a technology company that builds full-stack infrastructure to service the global AI industry . It is aimed at providing European innovators, such as startups, enterprises, developers, and researchers, with the necessary tools to build, scale, and deploy the next generation of AI applications .

Nvidia reportedly booked all server manufacturing capacity at Wistron's recently launched facility in Zhubei, Taiwan, to produce its next-generation Blackwell and Rubin AI systems . The orders, which extend through 2026, reflect Nvidia's aggressive push to secure critical AI infrastructure capacity .  AI server shipments have become a primary growth engine not only for Wistron but also for Quanta and Foxconn . Nvidia's control of the CoWoS supply chain and now server assembly capacity signals its strategic intent to dominate the AI hardware ecosystem .

A groundbreaking UBS report projects the humanoid robot market will explode from 2 million units by 2035 to 300 million by 2050 . This technological revolution addresses critical labor shortages and aging populations worldwide . Tesla (TSLA) leads the charge with its Optimus humanoid robot, designed to revolutionize manufacturing and household applications .  Tesla plans to invest $10 billion in autonomous technology and produce 5,000 Optimus humanoid robots in 2025 . CEO Elon Musk has dramatically shifted the company’s focus from its original 2006 mission of transitioning the world to sustainable transportation . Tesla bulls view robotics as crucial for future growth .  Taiwan Semiconductor (TSM) emerges as a critical enabler, manufacturing the advanced chips that power robot brains . As humanoids require sophisticated processing capabilities, TSM’s cutting-edge semiconductor technology becomes indispensable . The average TSLA stock price target is $292, below the current price near $345 .  UBS projects humanoid robot demand will surge from 15,000 units in 2025 to 86 million by 2050 . This growth could expand the related semiconductor market from $21 million to $177 billion over the same period . TSMC benefits from Taiwan’s comprehensive technology ecosystem, including AI capabilities, precision manufacturing, and component expertise in sensors, microcontrollers, and cameras .  Nvidia (NVDA) provides the AI foundation through its powerful processors that enable robot learning and decision-making . UBS analysts estimate humanoid robots could generate $400 billion in additional automation revenue by 2050, with industrial applications leading adoption before expanding into service sectors and households .  NVIDIA Isaac GR00T is the world’s first open foundation model for humanoid robot reasoning . This platform includes specialized blueprints for data generation, dexterous manipulation (GR00T-Dexterity), mobility navigation, whole-body control, and AI-based perception with long-term memory capabilities .  This article was originally published on Barchart.com . The author does not have (either directly or indirectly) positions in any of the securities mentioned in this article .

The "Magnificent Seven" stocks have generated impressive returns for long-term investors . But after years of big gains, most of the Magnificent Seven stocks are losing their luster . Apple is still overwhelmingly dependent on the iPhone, Amazon faces stiff competition from cheaper cross-border competitors .  Meta and Nvidia face fewer near-term headwinds than the other five stocks . Meta generates nearly all of its revenue from ads, and growth could slow down as the global economy cools off . Nvidia isn't immune to economic downturns and recessions, but expansion of its AI chipmaking business could offset that pressure .  Nvidia once generated most of its revenue from its gaming GPUs . But in its latest quarter, 89% came from its data center GPUs . Data center GPUs are better suited for processing complex AI tasks than stand-alone CPUs .  Analysts expect Nvidia's revenue and earnings per share to grow at compound annual growth rates of 30% and 28% from fiscal 2025 to fiscal 2028 . Nvidia has comfortably beat Wall Street's top- and bottom-line expectations for nine consecutive quarters . Its stock still looks reasonably valued relative to those estimates at 36 times forward earnings .  Nvidia locks in customers with its proprietary Compute Unified Device Architecture (CUDA) programming platform . Developers write their AI applications on CUDA, they become optimized for Nvidia's GPUs and can only be executed on its chips . That stickiness widens its moat againstAMDand other challengers .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is994% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . Zuckerberg is a former director of market development and spokeswoman for Facebook and sister to Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg . The Motley Fool recommends the following options: long January 2026 $395 calls on Microsoft .

AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) unveiled a major advance in its AI hardware roadmap in mid-June . The company introduced the Instinct MI350 accelerator series and offered a preview of the MI400 lineup expected in 2026 . The MI350 is positioned as a fourfold improvement over its predecessor, with AMD claiming it offers substantially better compute performance per dollar .  AMD slipped roughly 2% following the announcement . Analysts pointed to investor fatigue around AI chip hype and the longer ramp time for meaningful revenue . The next leg will hinge on customer deployments and real-world benchmarks .  Short-term AI stock. thebest short-term . stock. in the world. the best short-time AI stock . UBS says humanoid robots could drive a 40% annual growth rate in the tech sector through 2050, bolstering demand for chips and hardware . UBS estimates the semiconductor market linked to humanoid robots will rise from $21 million in 2025 to $177 billion by 2050 .  Nvidia, Qualcomm, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing listed as chipmakers positioned to benefit from trend . Nvidia's upcoming Thor platform for humanoid processing is cited as a near-term catalyst . UBS believes artificial intelligence is accelerating the timeline for adoption .  This article was first published by GuruFocus.com . Follow us on Twitter @dailymailonline.com for all the latest updates from GuruFocus .

Astera LabsALAB has positioned itself in the field of next-generation AI and cloud infrastructure with a robust start to 2025 . The company recently outlined a compelling roadmap powered by technological leadership across interconnect standards, a factor that now stands as its core growth engine . Astera has built a first-mover advantage with a full stack of PCIe Gen 6 solutions, including retimers, smart gearboxes, optical modules and fabric switches .  Marvell Technology is a notable peer in data center interconnects, with strengths in custom ASICs, PAM4 DSPs and 800G optical solutions . Astera Labs’ tighter integration of hardware and software gives it a unique edge in AI-specific system observability and fleet management .  Astera Labs has risen 26.2% in the past three months compared with the industry and the sector’s 10.2%, 7.5% growth, respectively . The S&P 500 index has improved 3.6% during the said period . Astera Lab currently carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy)  NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) is one of today’s Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks . Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days . Intel and NVIDIA are two premier semiconductor firms focusing on AI (artificial intelligence) and advanced chip technologies . NVIDIA is the worldwide leader in visual computing technologies and the inventor of the graphic processing unit, or GPU . Intel is gradually reducing its dependence on the PC-centric business by moving into data-centric businesses, such as AI and autonomous driving .  Intel is investing to expand its manufacturing capacity to accelerate its IDM 2.0 (Integrated Device Manufacturing) strategy . Nvidia's GPU platforms are playing a significant role in developing multi-billion-dollar end-markets, such as robotics and self-driving vehicles . Intel is making various decisions to gain a firmer footing in the expansive AI sector .  Intel's innovative AI solutions are set to benefit the broader semiconductor ecosystem . It remains on track with its 5N4Y (five nodes in four years) program to regain transistor performance and power performance leadership by 2025 .  NVIDIA is rapidly gaining traction in enterprise AI, expanding its market beyond cloud providers . The company’s DGX Cloud AI infrastructure allows enterprises to train and deploy AI models at scale . Intel faces potential market restrictions and increased competition from domestic chipmakers .  AI adoption expected to accelerate in 2025 and beyond, NVIDIA’s software and AI cloud solutions are a significant revenue driver . AI adoption is spreading beyond cloud hyperscalers, with industries such as healthcare, automotive and robotics increasingly investing in AI-powered solutions .  The Zacks Consensus Estimate for NVIDIA’s 2025 sales suggests year-over-year growth of 51.4%, while that for EPS implies a rise of 42.1% . AMD's MI300 AI accelerators and Intel's Gaudi AI chips are gaining traction, offering cost-effective alternatives for enterprises looking to diversify away from NVIDIA's high-priced GPUs .  Over the past year, Intel has declined 31.1% against the industry’s growth of 17.6%. NVIDIA has gained 21.8% over the same period . Intel and NVIDIA carry a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) Intel's shares currently trade at 1.78 forward sales, significantly lower than NVIDIA's 16.17 .  NVIDIA seems to be a better investment option at the moment . although the former is a bit expensive in terms of valuation metrics . Consequently, NVIDIA is a better option than AMD, which is more expensive than NVIDIA .

Nebius Group N.V. is expanding aggressively in North America and Europe . Backed by a $700 million funding round involving high-profile investors like NVIDIA and Accel in December 2024 .  In June 2025, NBIS announced private placement of $1 billion in convertible notes to capitalize on the AI-infrastructure boom and drive-up revenue opportunities in 2026 . The company holds a minority stake of approximately 28% in ClickHouse . Recent media reports suggest that a fundraising round is currently in progress, potentially valuing ClickHouse at around $6 billion .  Nebius competes with technology giants likeCoreWeave, Inc.CRWV andMicrosoft Corporation . CoreWeave is an AI-focused hyperscaler company . Its cloud platform has been designed to scale, support and accelerate GenAI .  Microsoft's increased availability in more than 60 announced regions globally is expected to have strengthened Microsoft's competitive position in the cloud computing market . For fourth-quarter fiscal 2025, management guided total revenues of $73.15–74.25 billion, with Azure/cloud growth projected at 34–35% constant currency . Shares of Nebius surged 153.3% in the past year compared with the Internet Software and Services industry’s growth of 39.3%.  Nebius Group N.V. currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) Internet Software Services industry’s 4.07X. NBIS is the latest in a growing list of strong-buyers in the market .

Siemens adds AI capabilities across EDA portfolio, enhancing productivity, accelerating innovation and speeding time-to-market . New AI system enables EDA engineers to leverage AI securely within established EDA environments . Siemens is showcasing how artificial intelligence (AI) can improve productivity, accelerate time to market .  EDA AI system delivers secure, advanced generative and agentic AI capabilities . Delivering openness, security and customizability across the entire EDA workflow . Customers can integrate their own data and create custom workflows using advanced AI .  Siemens' EDA AI system also supports NVIDIA NIMmicroservicesand NVIDIALlama Nemotronmodels . Siemens delivers data protection completely within customers' secure data centers .  AI agents can dramatically boost productivity for complex electronic design automation to support engineers across layout optimization, simulation and verification . "With NVIDIA NIM microservices and Llama Nemotron reasoning models, Siemens EDA can speed the development of tomorrow's most intricate electronic systems."  Aprisa AI delivers 10x productivity, 3x faster time to tapeout and 10 percent better PPA for digital designs across all process technologies . Calibre Vision AI offers a revolutionary advance in chip integration signoff by helping design teams identify and fix critical design violations in half the time of existing methods .  Calibre Vision AI is integrated into existing layout viewers and physical design tools to enable engineers to debug in their current implantation environment . Solido now harnesses Siemens' EDA AI system to deliver advanced generative and agentic AI capabilities .  Siemens' EDA AI system is currently available for early access across the Siemens EDA portfolio . To learn more about these advanced AI capabilities, visit:https://eda.sw.siemens.com/en-US/ic/solido/Solido .  Siemens Digital Industries (DI)empowers companies of all sizes within the process and discrete manufacturing industries to accelerate their digital and sustainability transformation across the entire value chain . Siemens Xcelerator – the open digital business platform – is made easier, faster, and scalable .  Siemens leverages its deep domain know-how to apply AI – including generative AI – to real-world applications . Siemens also owns a majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers . In fiscal 2024, the Siemens Group generated revenue of €75.9 billion and net income of €9.0 billion . Stocks recently featured in the blog include Palantir Technologies PLTR, Newmont NEM, NVIDIA NVDA, Microsoft MSFT and AngloGold Ashanti PLC AU . First half of 2025 has been defined by heightened volatility and uncertainty, largely stemming from the new administration’s trade policies .  On April 2, Donald Trump announced sweeping new tariffs dubbed “Liberation Day’ tariffs . These included a 10% baseline tariff on nearly all imports, with a few exceptions such as pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, and lumber . Dow Jones Industrial Average, however, remains only marginally positive for the year . Volatility is expected to persist in the second half .  Palantir Technologiessurged more than 90% since the April sell-off and recently hit a new all-time high . The stock saw a solid earnings estimate revision of 3 cents over the past 60 days for this year and has an estimated growth of 41.46%.  Newmont, having a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), is one of the best-performing stocks of the first half . The stock saw a positive earnings estimate revision of 5 cents for this year over the past month . Newmont has a VGM Score of A, indicating that it is poised for more gains ahead .  NVIDIA and Microsoft are locked in a high-stakes battle for market cap supremacy in 2025 . Microsoft held a slight lead with a market capitalization exceeding $3.57 trillion . NVIDIA, meanwhile, is capitalizing on an unprecedented demand cycle for its AI chips .  Microsoft and NVIDIA have a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) each . Gold stocks have surged in popularity this year, driven by a flight to safety amid growing global uncertainty . Gold recently soared to a new all-time high, topping $3,400 per ounce last month .  Gold could climb to $3,700 per ounce by the end of 2025, reinforcing the bullish outlook for the metal and gold stocks . Among the potential beneficiaries is AngloGold Ashanti PLC, a global gold mining company with operations across Africa, the Americas and Australia . The company has seen a solid earnings estimate revision of 60 cents over the past 30 days for this year . Investors are flocking to Chinese markets in a search for alternatives to U.S. equities . Hong Kong’s benchmark Hang Seng Index is up by over 20% so far this year, even as Trump threatened steep tariffs on imports from China . Investors have used the ‘Magnificent 7’—Microsoft, Apple, Alphabet, Amazon, Meta, Nvidia, and Tesla—as shorthand for the top-performing stocks on U.  Goldman Sachs highlights 10 stocks that are best poised for growth in the Chinese market . Unlike the Magnificent 7, these stocks cover more than just tech and AI, extending into retail and other consumer services . The bank predicts that the Prom 10’s earnings will grow by an average of 13% annually over the next two years .  Tencent is Asia’s second-most valuable company, behind chipmaker TSMC . E-commerce giant Alibaba is also on the Prom 10, thanks to optimism around AI .  BYD, the world’s largest producer of electric vehicles, and Xiaomi, also hold spots in Goldman Sachs’ “Prom 10” Chinese EVs are winning over customers both in China and overseas . Midea Group is one of China's leading manufacturers of home appliances .  Behind Nike and Adidas, Adidas is the world's second-biggest sports brand . Nike is the only major sports brand to compete with Adidas and Nike in the world .

AI firm DeepSeek is aiding China's military and intelligence operations, a senior U.S. official told Reuters . The startup sought to use Southeast Asian shell companies to access high-end semiconductors that cannot be shipped to China . Washington says capabilities behind rise of China's flagship AI enterprises may have been exaggerated .  DeepSeek is accused of sharing user data with Beijing's surveillance apparatus . Chinese law requires companies operating in China to provide data to the government when requested . U.S. also maintains restrictions on companies it believes are linked to China's military-industrial complex .  DeepSeek is referenced more than 150 times in procurement records for China's People's Liberation Army and other entities affiliated with the Chinese defense industrial base . U.S. official: Company is employing workarounds to circumvent export controls to gain access to advanced chips . Company has access to "large volumes" of Nvidia's high-end H100 chips, official says .  DeepSeek sought to use shell companies in Southeast Asia to evade export controls, U.S. official says . Official declines to say if company evaded export controls or offer further details about shell companies . Nvidia says it is "effectively out of China data centers" with current export controls .  DeepSeek has two of its AI models that Silicon Valley executives and U.S. tech company engineers have showered with praise . But experts have expressed skepticism, arguing the true costs of training the models were likely much higher than the $5.58 million the startup said was spent on computing power .  In February, Singapore charged three men with fraud in a case linked to the movement of Nvidia's advanced chips from the city state to DeepSeek . China has also been suspected of finding ways to use advanced U.S. chips remotely . Chinese companies are still allowed to access those same chips remotely in data centers .  Malaysia's trade ministry said last week that it was investigating whether an unnamed Chinese company in the country was using servers equipped with Nvidia chips for large language model training . The government is examining whether any domestic law or regulation had been breached .
